be.spacebel.webservice.authentication

Class EncryptionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.spacebel.webservice.authentication.EncryptionUtils

  • public class EncryptionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    The EncryptionUtils class provides methods to sign and encrypt XML element
    Author:
    Pierre Denis (pds), The Hoa Nguyen

    • Method Detail

      • cipherElement

        public void cipherElement(java.lang.String targetCertificateAlias,
                 org.w3c.dom.Document document,
                 org.w3c.dom.Element element,
                 boolean content)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Ciphers the given element in the given document, by using the public key present in the certificate of a target entity having the given alias; if the alias is null, then the local public key is used
        Parameters:
        targetCertificateAlias - alias of the certificate in the keystore to retrive the public key of the target entity
        document - DOM document containing the element to be encrypted
        element - DOM element to be encrypted
        content - flag indicating whether the element itself has to be encrypted (false) or its children have to be encrypted (true)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if encryption fails

      • signElement

        public void signElement(org.w3c.dom.Document document,
               org.w3c.dom.Element element)
                 throws org.apache.xml.security.exceptions.XMLSecurityException
        Calculates and put a digital signature for the given element in the given document
        Parameters:
        document - DOM document containing the element to be signed
        element - DOM element to be signed
        Throws:
        org.apache.xml.security.exceptions.XMLSecurityException - if signature fails

      • isRSTSignatureValid

        public boolean isRSTSignatureValid(org.w3c.dom.Element signatureElement)
                            throws org.apache.xml.security.signature.XMLSignatureException,
                                   org.apache.xml.security.exceptions.XMLSecurityException
        Validates whether the document has a valid signature
        Parameters:
        signatureElement - signature element
        Returns:
        true if and only if the signature is valid for the given document
        Throws:
        org.apache.xml.security.exceptions.XMLSecurityException
        org.apache.xml.security.signature.XMLSignatureException
